intro: Cotula microglossa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a small annual herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open areas. Cotula microglossa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
